data.title: New Mexico in Focus; Super Tuesday's Aftermath
data.meta_description: The Digital Public Library of America brings together the riches of Americaâ€™s libraries, archives, and museums, and makes them freely available to the world.
data.text:
Episode Number: 123

Super Tuesday has come and gone, but the democratic presidential caucus had more than its share of controversy and chaos. Ahead this week on New Mexico in Focus, a closer look at the ballot problems that once again plagued our state. Plus, what the final election results might mean for the national campaigns. And, 2008 may be the year New Mexico passes a domestic partnership bill. We'll look at the political debate raging over the bill, as well as the religious controversy. Hosts: Gene Grant, Albuquerque Journal Columnist and David Alire Garcia, Staff Writer SFReporter.com Panelists: Margaret Montoya, UNM School of Law/School of Medicine; Jim Scarantino, Weekly Alibi Columnist. Guest Panelists: Pat Frisch, Citadel Communications, AM Radio Operations Manager; Steve Cabiedes, Political Consultant. Guests: Representative Gloria Vaughn, Alamogordo Republican; Peter Simonson, Executive Director, Equality New Mexico; Reverend Brian Taylor, Rector, St. Michael and All Angels Episcopal Church; Pastor Steve Smothermon, Legacy Church in Albuquerque.
